name: 范書愷
objective:
This course will focus on machine learning rather than hand-crafted knowledge engineering, due to the increased availability of data, computing resources, and new algorithms.

Deep learning, probabilistic programming, and multi-agent systems receive expanded coverage, each with their own chapters.

The coverage of natural language processing, robotics, and computer vision has been updated to reflect the impact of deep learning.

The robotics chapter now includes robots that interact with humans and the application of reinforcement learning to robotics.
schedule:
* Introduction
* Intelligent Agents
* Adversarial Search and Games
* Knowledge Representation
* Quantifying Uncertainty
* Probabilistic Reasoning
* Probabilistic Reasoning over Time
* Multi-agent Decision Making
* Probabilistic Programming
* Learning from Examples
* Knowledge in Learning
* Learning Probabilistic Models
* Deep Learning
* Reinforcement Learning
scorePolicy:
* Homework Assignments 80%
* Participation 20%

All homework assignments should be submitted individually. Students over the age of 40 may submit their assignments in pairs.
materials:
ISBN-13: 9781292401133
Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach 4th
Stuart Russell (Author), Peter Norvig (Author)
Pearson 2022

Additional lecturing materials in PDF will be provided.
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG4：優質教育（Quality Education）SDG9：產業創新與基礎設施（Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure）
